meanings.definition: A person who is young and inexperienced.
meanings.sent1: The playground was full of snippersnappers playing tag.
meanings.sent2: The teacher patiently explained the lesson to the group of snippersnappers.
meanings.sent3: The snippersnappers giggled as they tried to solve the puzzle together.
meanings.sent4: The team of snippersnappers showed great potential in the soccer match.
meanings.sent5: The little snippersnappers looked up with wide eyes, eager to learn.

meanings.definition: To speak in a disrespectful or impertinent manner.
meanings.sent1: Please don't snippersnappers at your elders.
meanings.sent2: He tends to snippersnappers whenever he disagrees with someone.
meanings.sent3: The child snippersnappered at the idea of going to bed early.
meanings.sent4: Her words snippersnappered through the room, causing tension.
meanings.sent5: The student was reprimanded for snippersnappering during class.

meanings.definition: A small, quick, and sharp sound.
meanings.sent1: The snippersnappers of the scissors echoed in the room.
meanings.sent2: The sudden snippersnappers startled the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent3: The snippersnappers of the popcorn popping made everyone hungry.
meanings.sent4: The snippersnappers of the branches in the wind created a soothing rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The snippersnappers of the typewriter filled the office with a comforting noise.
